newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Tietmeyer to attend lira meeting, Waigel not.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer to attend lira meeting, Waigel not.

text.p: Bundesbank chief Hans Tietmeyer will be the only top level German official to attend a meeting of finance ministers and central bank heads on Sunday over the lira's return to Europe's currency grid, officials said.
They said German Finance Minister Theo Waigel would not be present at the Brussels talks, but that his French counterpart Jean Arthuis was to be there.

Europe's top financial officials have been summoned to Brussels in a bid to break a deadlock over conditions for the lira's re-entry to Europe's Exchange Rate Mechanism, a system providing monetary stability to member countries.
The European Union's monetary committee, grouping lower-level officials, failed to agree on terms in almost nine hours of talks on Saturday.
A finance ministry statement said the German government would be represented on Sunday by state secretary to the finance ministry Juergen Stark.
The meeting is due to start at 2.30 p.m. (1330 GMT).
